sentences.english: Highs: a wise decision in finding a good wife and a business that was doing quite well.
sentences.chinese: 成功的部分则会提及找到一个好太太和职场上的成功。

sentences.english: If so, Mr Cameron is well-placed.
sentences.chinese: 事实若真如此，那么卡梅伦则是身居“适”职。

sentences.english: Kindergartens , elementary and high schools are overall non-smoking areas.
sentences.chinese: 高中职以下学校属于全面禁烟场所。

sentences.english: The last part of the paper deals with the election of leading -post civil servant.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分讨论领导职公务员的选举。

sentences.english: We rely on part - time staff for most of our business.
sentences.chinese: 我们的大多数工作都依靠职人员完成。

sentences.english: Like the books of Chronicles and Ezra, Nehemiah has a priestly emphasis.
sentences.chinese: 一如历代志和以斯拉二书，尼希米也强调祭司职。

sentences.english: The workplace is filled with situations lending themselves to comedy.
sentences.chinese: 职场上处处充满了喜剧色彩。

sentences.english: He appointed the priests to their duties and encouraged them in the service of the Lord 's temple.
sentences.chinese: 王分派祭司各尽其职，又勉励他们办耶和华殿中的事。

sentences.english: Since I joined in 2006, I have been enjoying this job.
sentences.chinese: 自从2006年入职以来，我一直都很享受这份工作。

sentences.english: Engineers may also hold teaching positions or move up into management positions in business.
sentences.chinese: 工程师还可能任教职，或者从事企业的管理工作。

sentences.english: Saleh has been in power since 1978.
The upright position, also finally restored a set of big house portion.
sentences.chinese: 正直总算官恢复职，还分了一套大房子。

sentences.english: So she quits and becomes a real estate agent.
sentences.chinese: 所以，她辞了职，变成了一名房地产经纪人。

sentences.english: I have owned a job of QC, team-leader of a department, manager in the service sector.
sentences.chinese: 曾做过QC，部门主管，服务行业做过经理等职。

sentences.english: I worked for a trading company before.
sentences.chinese: 曾在一家贸易公司任过职。

sentences.english: I left them a fortnight ago, owing to a disagreement with the president Mr. Lau.
sentences.chinese: 由于本人与董事长刘先生意见不合，两星期前去职。

surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
to transfer/to move to another post
